name: Sangeetha Abdu Jyothi
content: Sangeetha Abdu Jyothi Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science Affiliate faculty, Center for Machine Learning and Intelligent Systems Affiliate faculty, UCI Networked Systems Program Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences University of California, Irvine Amazon Scholar (Amazon Prime Video) Email: sangeetha.aj@uci.edu Google Scholar LinkedIn I am an Assistant Professor in the Computer Science department at the University of California, Irvine. My research interests lie at the intersection of computer networking, systems, and machine learning. I completed my Ph.D. at the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign in 2019 where I was advised by Brighten Godfrey. I am also an Amazon Scholar with the Amazon Prime Video team. I lead the Networking, Systems, and AI Lab (NetSAIL) at UCI. My current focus revolves around: - Internet and Cloud Resilience - Systems and Machine Learning News 11/25: Our work on the impact of solar storms on LEO satellite networks was featured in New Scientist! 10/25: Invited talk at the UC Berkeley Sky Seminar on "Towards Trustworthy Learning-Enabled Networked Systems." 09/25: ArachNet accepted at HotNets '25. 09/25: Invited talk at Amazon Kuiper on "Network Resilience in Space: Solar Storm Impacts on LEO Satellite Networks." 09/25: Dave T√§ht Outstanding Paper Award at LEO-NET '25! 07/25: Thrilled to receive the NSF CAREER Award! 04/25: Agua accepted at SIGCOMM '25. 02/25: Invited talk at the ESNet Data and AI workshop at Berkeley on "Opening the Black Box: Explainability for Learning-Enabled Systems". 12/24: Best paper award at ACM CoNEXT '24! 10/24: Phoenix accepted at ASPLOS '25. 09/24: Concept-based explainability accepted at HotNets '24. 09/24: Plume accepted at CoNEXT '24. 05/24: Interviewed for a Scientific American article about the May 2024 solar storm. 05/24: StellaTrain accepted at SIGCOMM'24. 04/24: Invited Talk at UIUC SysNet Retreat on "Cross-Layer Internet Resilience under Planetary-Scale Risks". 12/23: LinguaLinked, our distributed LLM inference system for mobile devices, was featured in the New Scientist magazine. 12/23: Xaminer accepted at SIGMETRICS '24. 12/23: CrystalBox accepted at AAAI '24. 09/23: Nautilus accepted at SIGMETRICS '24. 08/23: Invited talk at the Indian Institute of Science on Understanding Internet Resilience to Planetary-Scale Risks. 06/23: Intereviewed for an article in the Washington Post on Internet resilience under solar storms. 05/23: Alagappan Ramanathan was selected as a Pulse Research Fellow by the Internet Society. 08/22: Interviewed for a BBC article on computer errors from space. 06/22: Honored to be selected as N2Women Rising Star in Networking and Communications. 04/22: cISP appeared at NSDI '22. 03/22: Thrilled to receive the IETF/IRTF Applied Networking Research Prize for my work on Internet resilience under solar superstorms. The talk at the IRTF meeting is online. 08/21: Presented "Solar Superstorms: Planning for an Internet Apocalypse" at SIGCOMM'21.
